verses.kjv: Who is this that cometh from Edom, with dyed garments from Bozrah? this that is glorious in his apparel, travelling in the greatness of his strength? I that speak in righteousness, mighty to save.
verses.ct: Who is this coming from Edom, with clothing stained crimson from Bozrah? Who is this, magnificent in his garments, striding forward with tremendous power? "It is I, the one who speaks in righteousness, mighty to save."

verses.kjv: Wherefore art thou red in thine apparel, and thy garments like him that treadeth in the winefat?
verses.ct: Why are your clothes so red, your garments like someone who has been stomping grapes in a winepress?

verses.kjv: I have trodden the winepress alone; and of the people there was none with me: for I will tread them in mine anger, and trample them in my fury; and their blood shall be sprinkled upon my garments, and I will stain all my raiment.
verses.ct: "I have trampled the winepress by myself; not one person from any nation stood with me. I crushed them in my anger and stomped them in my rage. Their blood splattered on my clothing, and I stained everything I was wearing."

verses.kjv: For the day of vengeance is in mine heart, and the year of my redeemed is come.
verses.ct: "The day of vengeance was set in my heart, and the year to rescue my people had arrived."

verses.kjv: And I looked, and there was none to help; and I wondered that there was none to uphold: therefore mine own arm brought salvation unto me; and my fury, it upheld me.
verses.ct: "I looked around, but no one came to help. I was astonished that no one stepped up to assist. So my own power brought salvation, and my rage sustained me."

verses.kjv: And I will tread down the people in mine anger, and make them drunk in my fury, and I will bring down their strength to the earth.
verses.ct: "I trampled nations in my anger and made them stagger with my fury, and I poured out their lifeblood on the ground."

verses.kjv: I will mention the lovingkindnesses of the LORD, and the praises of the LORD, according to all that the LORD hath bestowed on us, and the great goodness toward the house of Israel, which he hath bestowed on them according to his mercies, and according to the multitude of his lovingkindnesses.
verses.ct: I will tell of the LORD's faithful love and declare his praises — everything the LORD has done for us, his tremendous goodness toward the house of Israel that he has shown them because of his mercy and his abundant faithful love.

verses.kjv: For he said, Surely they are my people, children that will not lie: so he was their Saviour.
verses.ct: He said, "Surely they are my people, children who will not be dishonest." So he became their Savior.

verses.kjv: In all their affliction he was afflicted, and the angel of his presence saved them: in his love and in his pity he redeemed them; and he bare them, and carried them all the days of old.
verses.ct: In every hardship they faced, he shared their pain. The angel of his presence rescued them. Out of his love and compassion he redeemed them. He lifted them up and carried them through all the ancient days.

verses.kjv: But they rebelled, and vexed his holy Spirit: therefore he was turned to be their enemy, and he fought against them.
verses.ct: But they rebelled and grieved his Holy Spirit. So he turned and became their enemy, and he himself fought against them.

verses.kjv: Then he remembered the days of old, Moses, and his people, saying, Where is he that brought them up out of the sea with the shepherd of his flock? where is he that put his holy Spirit within him?
verses.ct: Then his people remembered the ancient days of Moses, asking, "Where is the one who brought them up through the sea along with the shepherd of his flock? Where is the one who placed his Holy Spirit among them?"

verses.kjv: That led them by the right hand of Moses with his glorious arm, dividing the water before them, to make himself an everlasting name?
verses.ct: "Where is the one who sent his glorious power to work through Moses' right hand, splitting the waters in front of them to establish his reputation forever?"

verses.kjv: That led them through the deep, as an horse in the wilderness, that they should not stumble?
verses.ct: "Where is the one who led them through the deep waters? Like a horse running across open plains, they never stumbled."

verses.kjv: As a beast goeth down into the valley, the Spirit of the LORD caused him to rest: so didst thou lead thy people, to make thyself a glorious name.
verses.ct: Like cattle going down into a valley to find rest, the Spirit of the LORD gave them a place of peace. That is how you guided your people, earning yourself a glorious reputation.

verses.kjv: Look down from heaven, and behold from the habitation of thy holiness and of thy glory: where is thy zeal and thy strength, the sounding of thy bowels and of thy mercies toward me? are they restrained?
verses.ct: Look down from heaven and see us from your holy and glorious dwelling place! Where is your passion and your power? Where is your deep compassion and your mercy toward me? Are you holding them back?

verses.kjv: Doubtless thou art our father, though Abraham be ignorant of us, and Israel acknowledge us not: thou, O LORD, art our father, our redeemer; thy name is from everlasting.
verses.ct: You are without question our Father. Even if Abraham doesn't recognize us and Israel doesn't acknowledge us, you, LORD, are our Father. "Our Redeemer from ancient times" — that is your name.

verses.kjv: O LORD, why hast thou made us to err from thy ways, and hardened our heart from thy fear? Return for thy servants’ sake, the tribes of thine inheritance.
verses.ct: LORD, why have you let us wander from your paths and made our hearts resistant to wholehearted dedication to you? Come back for the sake of your servants, the tribes that belong to you.

verses.kjv: The people of thy holiness have possessed it but a little while: our adversaries have trodden down thy sanctuary.
verses.ct: Your holy people possessed the land for only a short time before our enemies trampled your sanctuary.

verses.kjv: We are thine: thou never barest rule over them; they were not called by thy name.
verses.ct: We have become like people you never ruled over, like those who were never called by your name.
